feed.title: NewsTracker: nepal

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Choppers ferry injured to Gorkha
entry.summary: An elderly woman, injured in Saturday's earthquake, sits outside Bhaktapur public hospital in Bhaktapur, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

entry.title: Helicopters ferry injured from Nepal villages near epicenter
entry.summary:
Preparing to make a push into the most isolated parts of quake-devastated Nepal, soldiers on Tuesday were readying food, water and other emergency supplies to be loaded onto helicopters in this small town near the earthquake's epicenter.

A Nepalese boy talks on a mobile phone near a damaged minaret of a mosque in Kathmandu, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

entry.title: Nepal troops ready aid for remote quake-hit villages
entry.summary:
A helicopter carrying supplies and officials lands at a relief staging area near Saturday's massive earthquake's epicenter in the town of Gorkha, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

Survivors of Saturday's earthquake read newspaper at a makeshift camp in Kathmandu, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

A survivor of Saturday's earthquake plays with his son after spending night in an open ground from fears of earthquake tremors in Kathmandu, Nepal, Tuesday, April 28, 2015.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: Government ill-equipped to handle earthquake tragedy
entry.summary: Kathmandu: As the death toll from Nepal's massive earthquake passed 4200 on Monday, it was not just drinking water, hospital beds, gasoline, electricity and sanitary facilities that were in short supply.

entry.title: In quake-hit Nepal, rescuers struggle to recover the dead
entry.summary: Nepal is an overwhelmingly Hindu nation and has a small Christian population who comprise 1.4 percent of the country's 27 million people.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Choppers ferry injured to Gorkha
entry.summary: A Nepal police official says at least 4,352 bodies have so far been recovered after last week's massive earthquake that struck just outside of capital Kathmandu.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake moves Kathmandu but Everest height unchanged ? experts
entry.summary: The earthquake that devastated Nepal and left thousands of people dead shifted the earth beneath Kathmandu by up to several metres south, but the height of Mount Everest likely stayed the same, experts said Tuesday.

entry.title: Police say at least 4,352 people have been confirmed dead in Nepal after massive quake
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) - Police say at least 4,352 people have been confirmed dead in Nepal after massive quake.

entry.title: In quake-hit Nepal, rescue workers struggle to recover the dead as toll climbs
entry.summary: The estimated death toll from Nepal's earthquake soared past 4,000, and could go much higher if it turns out that vulnerable mountain villages - where information is still scarce and rescue workers are still struggling to reach - were hit hard.

entry.title: In Post-Quake Aid Rush, Nepal Neighbors Jockey for Position
entry.summary: But recent years have seen Nepal forge closer ties with China as a counterweight, and the Nepalese government has assured Beijing that it will not tolerate any anti-China political activism by Tibetans in Nepal.

entry.title: In post-quake aid rush, Nepal neighbors jockey for position
entry.summary: BEIJING (AP) - Wedged between the two rising Asian powers of China and India, landlocked Nepal watched rescuers and offers of help pour in from both sides within hours of an earthquake that killed more than 4,000 people.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: ADF to airlift survivors as international rescue effort intensifies
entry.summary: Kathmandu: Australians stranded in Nepal following Saturday's devastating earthquake will be airlifted out by the Defence Force as aid agencies warn of deteriorating conditions in some affected parts of the country.

entry.title: Nepal troops ready aid for remote quake-hit villages
entry.summary: Medical and rescue teams from Russia, Japan, France, Switzerland and Singapore were expected in Kathmandu over the coming days, the Nepal army said.

entry.title: AP Interview: UNESCO chief says possible reconstruction of Nepal cultural sites to be assessed
entry.summary: Bokova said another of Nepal's World Heritage sites, Sagarmatha National Park around Mount Everest, is damaged, but the extent is not yet known.

entry.title: Chicago climber OK after Mount Everest avalanche, Nepal earthquake
entry.summary: This aerial photo provided by Shreejan Bhandari, shows Basantapur Durbar Square, in Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Nepal quake death toll tops 4,000; villages plead for aid
entry.summary: Two teams of U.S. Army Green Beret soldiers happened to be in Nepal when the quake struck, and the 26 Americans - who were training with the Nepalese army - are staying to help with search-and-relief efforts.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Aid worker in epicenter district
entry.summary: In this photo provided by World Vision, a house stands destroyed by s earthquake at Paslang village in Gorkha municipality, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Quake-aid need acute in Nepal capital, more so in villages
entry.summary:
Nepalese residents carry belongings from their destroyed homes as they walk through debris of Saturday's earthquake, in Bhaktapur on the outskirts of Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

Portraits and a wall clock is seen hanging on the remains of a house damaged in Saturday's earthquake in Bhaktapur, on the outskirts of Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Expats try phones, social apps to connect to quake-hit Nepal
entry.summary: After the earthquake hit Nepal, Prem Raja Mahat spent a sleepless night at his Baltimore home, trying again and again to reach his son, who was visiting friends and family back in Mahat's home country.

entry.title: Quake-aid need acute in Nepal capital, more so in villages
entry.summary: Nepalese victims of Saturday's earthquake lie inside an Indian air force helicopter as they are evacuated from Trishuli Bazar to Kathmandu airport in Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Death toll in Nepal quake reaches 3,726 - official
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, April 27 (Reuters) - The number of people killed in Nepal by the Himalayan country's worst earthquake in eight decades has risen to 3,726, a home ministry official said on Monday.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Aid worker in epicenter district
entry.summary: Nepal's police say at least 3,617 people have been confirmed killed in Saturday's earthquake, including 1,302 in the Kathmandu Valley alone.

entry.title: Rescuers struggle to reach remote Nepal areas as toll rises
entry.summary:
Nepalese residents gather in an open space at the site of destruction caused after Saturday's earthquake in Bhaktapur, on the outskirts of Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

Rescue teams' members identify bodies dug out of the collapsed Sitapyla church in Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Quake-aid need acute in Nepal capital, more so in villages
entry.summary: A strong magnitude 7.8 earthquake shook Nepal's capital and the densely populated Kathmandu Valley on Saturday, causing extensive damage with toppled walls and collapsed buildings.

entry.title: Deaths rise, aid flown in after Nepal quake: Things to Know
entry.summary: Locals take snapshots with their cell phones at the historic Dharahara Tower, a city landmark, that was damaged in Saturday's earthquake in Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: Deaths Rise, Aid Flown in After Nepal Quake: Things to Know
entry.summary: The death toll climbed above 3,300 on Monday, two days after a magnitude-7.8 earthquake struck central Nepal and surrounding regions.

entry.title: Deaths rise, aid flown in after Nepal quake: Things to Know
entry.summary: A Hindu Nepalese woman offers prayers at Indrayani temple, that was damaged in Saturday's earthquake, in Kathmandu, Nepal, Monday, April 27, 2015.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Gorkha toll could change picture
entry.summary: Japan says it will provide emergency relief goods such as tents and blankets worth 25 million yen ($210,000) to Nepal, through the Japan International Cooperation Agency following the massive earthquake on Saturday.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Gorkha Toll Could Change Picture
entry.summary: The Israeli military said it is sending a search and rescue crew to Nepal on Monday to help locate survivors in the rubble, set up a medical field hospital for locals, and bring Israeli travelers home.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Entire army involved in rescue
entry.summary:
She says the team will also assist with humanitarian assessments to support Nepal's government and the international relief efforts.

Kathmandu district chief administrator Ek Narayan Aryal says tents and water are being handed at 10 locations in Nepal's capital, but that the many aftershocks were leaving everyone jittery.

entry.title: The Latest on Nepal Quake: Gorkha toll could change picture
entry.summary: A strong magnitude earthquake shook Nepal's capital and the densely populated Kathmandu valley on Saturday devastating the region and leaving tens of thousands shell-shocked and sleeping in streets.

entry.title: No time to lose: Global response to Nepal quake gears up
entry.summary:
The United Arab Emirates deployed an 88-member search-and-rescue team to Nepal Sunday, and the Emirates Red Crescent also sent a team.

The Israeli military said it is sending a 260-member mission to Nepal to provide immediate search-and-rescue help and medical aid.

entry.title: No time to lose: Global response to Nepal quake gears up
entry.summary:
Members of a German rescue organization board a plane at the airport in Frankfurt, central Germany, Sunday, April 26, 2015, for their flight to earthquake-torn Nepal.

International Search and Rescue Germany says a team of 52 relief workers including doctors, experts trained in searching for people buried under rubble and several dog squads will fly to Nepal.

entry.title: How to help Nepal earthquake victims
entry.summary: Aid groups are rushing to get crucial supplies to survivors of Nepal's devastating earthquake, which has killed more than 2,500 people.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: no reports of Britons killed or injured, says Foreign Office
entry.summary: The British Foreign Office has received no reports of British nationals being killed or injured in the Nepal earthquake, but said it has helped hundreds of people.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: climbers trapped on Mount Everest 'getting desperate'
entry.summary: The aftershock occurred around 1pm Nepal time Sunday and registered 6.7 on the Richter scale, according to the US Geological Survey.

entry.title: 3 U.S. Citizens Among Dead In Avalanche After Nepal Quake
entry.summary: Nearly 2,500 people were confirmed killed in the 7.9 magnitude quake, making it the worst such disaster to hit Nepal since 1934 when 8,500 died.

entry.title: Shocks terrify survivors of Nepal quake that killed 2,500
entry.summary: Nepal authorities said Sunday that at least 2,430 people died in that country alone, not including the 18 dead in the avalanche.

entry.title: Nepal earthquake: Video emerges of moment avalanche hit Everest base camp
entry.summary: At least one Australian is reportedly among the more than 2500 people who were killed when the 7.9 magnitude quake rocked Nepal on Saturday.

entry.title: More than 830 Australians safe in Nepal
entry.summary: Authorities have confirmed more than 830 Australians in Nepal are safe after a devastating earthquake in the country.

entry.title: Chaos mars Nepal quake relief operations
entry.summary: At least 5,000 people were injured across Nepal.

entry.title: No power, comms for Nepal quake rescuers
entry.summary: Foreign Minister Julie Bishop says more than 850 Australians are confirmed safe in Nepal.

entry.title: Nepal soccer head stands down during FIFA financial probe
entry.summary: The 90-day sanction bars All Nepal Football Association president Ganesh Thapa from attending the Asian Football Confederation election congress in Bahrain on April 30.

entry.title: Nepal soccer head stands down during FIFA financial probe
entry.summary:
FIFA says Nepal's top soccer official has extended his self-imposed ban while the governing body's ethics committee investigates possible financial wrongdoing.

Thapa has led Nepal's soccer body for two decades.

entry.title: Everest Climbers Forced to Quit Last Year to Get New Permits
entry.summary: Nepal has cleared more than 300 mountaineers to climb Mount Everest after they had to abandon last year's efforts when an ice avalanche killed 16 guides in the mountain's deadliest disaster, an official said Friday.

entry.title: Nepal to give new Everest climbing permits to hundreds forced to quit after tragedy last year
entry.summary:
The head of Nepal's tourism department, Tulasi Gautam, says the government is extending last year's permits without charging new fees.

Nepal also pledged recently to improve weather forecasting, security and rescue efforts, and has cut climbing fees this year to $11,000 per climber from $25,000.

entry.title: Nepal jails man for 35 years for rape, murder of 7-year-old
entry.summary:
The sentences are the maximum allowed for those offenses in Nepal.

Menuka Thapa of Raksha Nepal, an organization that supports sexually exploited girls in Nepal, said people are also more educated now and more cases are being reported.

entry.title: Nepal jails man for 35 years for rape, murder of 7-year-old
entry.summary:
A court in southern Nepal has sentenced a man to 35 years in prison for the rape and murder of a 7-year-old girl, officials said Wednesday, in a case that sparked outrage in the Himalayan nation.

There are conflicting data on sexual crimes in Nepal, but rights groups say the number of rape cases in the country has increased in recent years.

entry.title: Nepal boosts doctors, rescue efforts at Everest base camp
entry.summary: Nepal was criticized for not having a rescue plan during disasters or any government presence at the base camp despite charging climbers huge permit fees.

entry.title: Nepal boosts doctors, rescue efforts at Everest base camp
entry.summary: Four doctors, up from two or three in the past, will be stationed at the base camp's emergency room tent, which will be equipped to handle almost any medical need, said Devi Bahadur Koirala of the Himalayan Rescue Association Nepal.

entry.title: Nepal airport reopens after runway cleared
entry.summary:
KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) " Nepal's only international airport reopened four days after a Turkish Airlines jet skidded and blocked the single runway, the aviation authority said Sunday.

Nepal's government said it will wave visa fees for the stranded passengers.

entry.title: Turkish Airlines jet carrying 238 passengers crash lands after over-shooting runway in Nepal?
entry.summary: The only international airport in Nepal remained closed Wednesday morning after the accident.

entry.title: Turkish Airlines plane skids off Nepal runway
Too much human poo on Mount Everest says Nepal
entry.summary: Hundreds of foreign climbers attempt to scale Everest during Nepal's mountaineering season, which began this week and runs through May. Last year's season was canceled after 16 local guides were killed in an avalanche in April.

entry.title: Nepal official says human waste on Everest a major problem
entry.summary:
KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) " Human waste left by climbers on Mount Everest has become a problem that is causing pollution and threatening to spread disease on the world's highest peak, the chief of Nepal's mountaineering association said Tuesday.

He said Nepal's government needs to get the climbers to dispose of the waste properly so the mountain remains pristine.

Nepal's government has not come up with a plan yet to tackle the issue of human waste.
